frame.name: Change_of_phase
frame.definition: <def-root>In this frame a <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase. Note that this frame contrasts with Change_of_consistency in that this frame describes a change of a <fen>Patient</fen> between different phases (i.e. solid to liquid or frozen to "unfrozen"). <ex><fex name="Patient">The water</fex> <t>froze</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The rock</fex> <t>solidifies</t> <fex name="Initial_state">from its molten state</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The lake</fex> <t>froze</t> <fex name="Result">solid</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The lake</fex> <t>froze</t> <fex name="Result">into ice</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Patient">The lake</fex> <t>froze</t> <fex name="Degree">to depths of 30 feet</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change of phase. <ex><fex name="Patient">The water</fex> <t>froze</t>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Result</fen> indicates the result of the change of phase.
<ex>The lake <t>froze</t> <fex name="Result">solid</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Initial_state
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the original state of the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>The rock <t>solidified</t> <fex name="Initial_state"> from its molten state</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>Degree to which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase. <ex>The lake <t>froze</t> <fex name="Degree">to depths of 30 feet</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> at which the change of phase occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Circumstances</fen> at which the phase change occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.
<ex>The cloth <t>froze</t> <fex name="sub">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>
